thread.title: Westlake to move I-90/Columbia Road interchange ramps to reduce traffic delays, accidents
thread.title_full: Westlake to move I-90/Columbia Road interchange ramps to reduce traffic delays, accidents | cleveland.com

author: Chanda Neely, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Westlake to move I-90/Columbia Road interchange ramps to reduce traffic delays, accidents
text:
WESTLAKE, Ohio — Westlake next year will begin a $3.8 million project to move the I-90 eastbound entrance and exit ramps at Columbia Road farther from Detroit Road, to reduce traffic delays and crashes.
More than 45,000 vehicles travel the intersection at Columbia and Detroit roads every day.
A 2008 study, the most recent data available, reported 176 crashes in the area during a three-year period. The majority — 62 percent — of the crashes were rear-end collisions most likely caused by close signal spacing, the study says.
Talks of the realignment have been ongoing since 2009 , but the city didn't have the money to pay for it.
The city has received a $2 million Ohio Department of Transportation grant, and is applying for more funding from the Northeast Ohio Areawide Coordinating Agency .
This year, Westlake paid $15,000 to reposition signals north of the interchange and add a left turn signal for northbound Columbia Road traffic to head westbound on I-90.
The realignment project will go out for bid in the spring, and work will begin sometime after the Republican National Convention scheduled for July.
Work will take a year to complete, but two traffic lanes will be maintained during construction, city Engineer Bob Kelly said.
